q_en: Have all of John's orders been completed?

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'John';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "John"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE user_id = '2';
steps.description: Retrieve all order IDs for the customer "John"

steps.sql: SELECT order_id, SUM(number) as total_quantity FROM order_product WHERE order_id IN (2, 10) GROUP BY order_id;
steps.description: Retrieve the total quantity of products for each order of "John"

steps.sql: SELECT op.order_id, SUM(st.completed_number) as completed_quantity FROM order_product op JOIN sewing_tasks st ON op.id = st.order_product_id WHERE op.order_id IN (2, 10) GROUP BY op.order_id;
steps.description: Retrieve the total completed quantity of sewing tasks for each order of "John"

steps.sql: SELECT oq.order_id, CASE WHEN oq.total_quantity = cq.completed_quantity THEN 'Completed' ELSE 'Not Completed' END as order_status FROM (SELECT order_id, SUM(number) as total_quantity FROM order_product WHERE order_id IN (2, 10) GROUP BY order_id) oq LEFT JOIN (SELECT op.order_id, SUM(st.completed_number) as completed_quantity FROM order_product op JOIN sewing_tasks st ON op.id = st.order_product_id WHERE op.order_id IN (2, 10) GROUP BY op.order_id) cq ON oq.order_id = cq.order_id;
steps.description: Compare the total completed quantity with the total quantity for each order to determine if all orders are completed

response:
Hello there! üòÑ Let's take a look at John's orders to see if they've all been completed. Here's what we found:

| Order ID | Order Status   |
|----------|----------------|
| 2        | Completed      |
| 10       | Not Completed  |

It seems like not all of John's orders are completed. Order ID 2 is all set, but Order ID 10 still needs some work. If you have any more questions or need further assistance, feel free to ask! üòä
